definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: I started the course of Pantomime. I love the feel of learning.
sentences.chinese: 終於開始學習默劇了，很喜歡學習的感覺。

sentences.english: Demonstration of French style mime. A Silence Theatre production.
sentences.chinese: 無聲模式製作，傳統法國式默劇示範。

sentences.english: Mime is the art of re-creating the world by moving and positioning the human body.
sentences.chinese: 默劇是透過身體的移動及定位，去重新創造這個世界。

sentences.english: Mime is one of the oldest forms of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 默劇是最古老的表演形式之一。

sentences.english: In additiontomagicandclowning, he is a highly skilled ventriloquist and pantomimist.
sentences.chinese: 除了魔術，小丑，他是高度熟練的口技和默劇。

sentences.english: Teaching of illusion technique of miming. Produced by Silence Theatre.
sentences.chinese: 無聲模式製作，法國式默劇幻象技巧教授。

definition: lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
